items.title: Thomas Cook (India) reports net profit of Rs 66.4 cr for Q2FY26, revenues at Rs 2074 cr
items.description: Thomas Cook India has reported a net profit of Rs 66.4 crore for the September quarter. Revenue from operations saw a 3.5% rise. The company demonstrated resilience despite global challenges. Forex business and retail sales showed growth. New properties were added by Sterling Holidays. App bookings and Forex by WhatsApp transactions also increased. The company maintains a strong financial position.

items.title: Tata Steel’s Q2 consolidated profit surges fourfold to Rs 3,183 crore
items.description: Tata Steel reported a significant profit jump in the September quarter. India operations drove strong volume growth. The Netherlands unit saw a sharp rise in operating profit. The company also narrowed losses in its UK operations. Sales increased year-on-year. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortisation rose substantially.

items.title: Ashok Leyland net profit up 7% at Rs 820 crore
items.description: Ashok Leyland reported a record consolidated net profit of ₹820 crore in the September quarter, a 7% increase year-on-year, driven by broad-based segment recovery and operational efficiencies. Consolidated revenue also rose 13% to ₹12,577 crore, with the company achieving its 12th consecutive quarter of double-digit Ebitda margin.

items.title: Q2 results today: Investors will see whether LG India justifies wave of buy calls it received after IPO
items.description: LG Electronics India, a successful 2025 listing, is set to announce its first quarterly results today. The company, which saw over 50% listing gains, will face investor scrutiny on whether its strong fundamentals and market leadership justify the post-IPO euphoria. Analysts remain optimistic about its growth trajectory and profitability.

items.title: Asian Paints reports strong Q2 earnings with double-digit growth in decorative paints
items.description: Asian Paints achieved strong sales growth in decorative paints, marking a significant turnaround. The company's profit also saw year-on-year improvement. This positive performance comes despite challenging market conditions. Demand is expected to be supported by upcoming festive seasons and agricultural output. Asian Paints continues to focus on cost efficiencies and brand investments.
